job_title: Fall 2023- Systems Design and Platform Engineering Extern - 90359421
description:
About the job
Your success is a train ride away!

As we move America’s workforce toward the future, Amtrak connects businesses and communities across the country. We employ more than 20,000 diverse, energetic professionals in a variety of career fields throughout the United States. The safety of our passengers, our employees, the public and our operating environment is our priority, and the success of our railroad is due to our employees.

Are you ready to join our team?

Our values of ‘Do the Right Thing, Excel Together and Put Customers First’ are at the heart of what matters most to us, and our Core Capabilities, ‘Building Trust, Accountability, Effective Communication, Customer Focus, and Proactive Safety & Security’ are what every employee needs to know and do to be most impactful at Amtrak. By living the Amtrak values, focusing on our capabilities, and actively embracing and fostering diverse ideas, backgrounds, and perspectives, together we will honor our past and make Amtrak a company of the future.

Position Summary

The Systems Design and Platform Engineering Extern helps design the end-to-end solutions, integration, testing processes, and delivery of infrastructure and services associated with operating IT projects.

Essential Functions

Assist in the development and implementation of data-driven projects
Collaborate with the team to analyze and interpret data
Help to create visualizations and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders
Assist with the maintenance and organization of data sets
Participate in team meetings and presentations

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s, Master’s, or MBA degree with a focus in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field. .
6 months of relevant experience
Demonstrated leadership experience.
High initiative with the ability to multi-task and deliver results in a team and/or autonomous setting.
Proficiency with databases and search engines, Microsoft Office, including Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Strong presentation skills, including written and oral and facilitation skills
Demonstrated ability to build rapport within all levels of the organization and communicate effectively with all levels.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and R, SQL
Experience with data analysis and visualization tools such as Excel, Power BI, and Tableau
Excellent communication and teamwork skills

Preferred Qualifications

Experience in Noise to Signal Analysis
Experienced in Data regressions and validation
Practical Experience in ETL Data integrations

Communication And Interpersonal Skills

Must have excellent oral and written communication skills

The hourly range is $17.50 per hour - $35.00 per hour. Pay is based on factors including school year, program of study, etc. In addition, paid externships include Amtrak rail pass privileges as a part of the experience along with one (1) PTO day per academic year.

Requisition ID:158990

Posting Location(s):N/A

Job Family/Function:Information Technology

Relocation Offered:No

Travel Requirements:None

You power our progress through your performance.

We want your work at Amtrak to be more than a job. We want your career at Amtrak to be a fulfilling experience where you find challenging work, rewarding opportunities, respect among colleagues, and attractive compensation. Amtrak maintains a culture that values high performance and recognizes individual employee contributions.

Amtrak is committed to a safe workplace free of drugs and alcohol. All Amtrak positions requires a pre-employment background check that includes prior employment verification, a criminal history check and a pre-employment drug screen.

Candidates who test positive for marijuana will be disqualified, regardless of any state or local statute, ordinance, regulation, or other law that legalizes or decriminalizes the use or possession of marijuana, whether for medical, recreational, or other use. Amtrak's pre-employment drug testing program is administered in accordance with DOT regulations and applicable law.

In accordance with DOT regulations (49 CFR

40.25), Amtrak is required to obtain prior drug and alcohol testing records for applicants/employees intending to perform safety-sensitive duties for covered Department of Transportation positions. If an applicant/employee refuses to provide written consent for Amtrak to obtain these records, the individual will not be permitted to perform safety-sensitive functions.

In accordance with federal law governing security checks of covered individuals for providers of public transportation (Title 6 U.S.C.

1143), Amtrak is required to screen applicants for any permanent or interim disqualifying criminal offenses.

Note that any education requirement listed above may be deemed satisfied if you have an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Amtrak is an EOE/Affirmative Action Minority/Female employer, and we welcome all to apply. We consider candidates regardless of race/color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth and related conditions), national origin/ethnicity, age, disability (intellectual, mental and physical), veteran status, marital status, ancestry, sexual orientation, gender identity and gender expression, genetic information, citizenship or any other personal characteristics protected by law.
title: cloud engineer intern

description:
About the job
If you are a Cloud Engineer with experience, please read on!

We are industry leaders helping the deaf community and making a difference in people's lives. A stable company with a startup-like culture. We are seeking a Senior Cloud Engineer to join our growing team to design, architect, provision, and allocate underlying cloud infrastructure, including networking, compute, and storage by leveraging public cloud technologies to provide improved product resiliency and self-serving ability to other product teams. The ideal candidate is strong with terraform an experience with automation. If this sounds like you, please apply today!

What You Will Be Doing
Implement and optimize foundational platforms with the Cloud using Infrastructure-as-Code, Policy-as-Code and other automation to drive consistency, repeatability, sustainability and auditability
Develop and establish processes, procedures, and automation to support patching & monitoring of cloud-based environments
Self-starter with the ability to independently resolve issues and deliver results
Develops and promotes infrastructure technology standards through automation and service-based development.
Document and drive issues through resolution, escalating to stake holders, and IT management as necessary.
Other duties as assigned.
What You Need for this Position

The Ideal Candidate Will Have
Strong Terraform Skills
Experience with Automation
Huge plus if you have expeirence with platform services
AWS
Minimum Years Of Experience
5 years enterprise DevOps, Cloud platform operations, SRE experience
5 years building and managing large enterprise grade cloud-based platforms
4 years proven administrative experience in large AWS/Azure Cloud environments
3 years hands-on experience building Infrastructure as Code using Terraform & Cloud Formation Tools
Skills We Are Looking For
Experience with Configuration Management tools (Ansible, Chef, etc.)
Experience with CI/CD pipeline orchestration (Code Pipeline, GitHub actions, etc.)
Proficiency working with containers and container orchestration (i.e., Kubernetes)
Familiarity with one or more scripting languages (Python, JavaScript, Bash, PowerShell)
Experience with networking principles and technologies (DNS, Load Balancers, Reverse Proxies, etc.)
Familiarity with High Availability and Disaster Recovery principles, patterns, and usage
An ability to articulate fundamental security practices when operating in cloud environment to maintain secure environments
Understanding of what DevOps patterns consist of and how to implement/define them
Ability to troubleshoot operation issues with knowledge of IP networking, DNS, TGW and Linux operating systems
Proficient in EC2/VPC configurations
Experience with agile processes for PM, development, and tracking
Awareness of on-premises virtualization technologies (i.e., VMware)
Bonuses To Have
AWS Solutions Architect Certification or other platform certifications
Experience in serverless architecture, deployment, and support
Understanding of Security/Compliance/Management in AWS
What's In It for You
Salary: $115k-$140k+ depending on expeirence, etc. with up to 20% bonus
Constant pursuit of cutting-edge innovation and industry leading experience bring the most unique and reliable products and services
Stable company with startup culture: tons of growth opportunity!
Remote (or hybrid available if in Utah)
Medical, Dental, & Vision
Several insurance options
401k Plans: Retirement plans with 6% company match so you can save for your future
Wellness: Programs that encourage work-life balance in all aspects of physical, mental and financial wellbeing
Benefits
Vacation/PTO
Medical
Dental
Vision
401k
Bonus: 20%
So, if you are a Senior Cloud Engineer with experience, please apply today!

Colorado employees will receive paid sick leave. For additional information about available benefits, please contact Jen Fick

Email Your Resume In Word To

Looking forward to receiving your resume through our website and going over the position with you. Clicking apply is the best way to apply, but you may also:

Jen.Fick@CyberCoders.com
Please do NOT change the email subject line in any way. You must keep the JobID: linkedin : JF12-1749938L720 -- in the email subject line for your application to be considered.***
Jen Fick - Executive Recruiter - CyberCoders

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Your Right to Work – In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

CyberCoders will consider for Employment in the City of Los Angeles qualified Applicants with Criminal Histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring (Ban the Box) Ordinance.
